title: AC V5
release_notes: Add Mastitis question to Question 23 and generate MCAPs when the protocol does not match the action

enum: Reviewing blood test results to confirm successful transfer of passive immunity
Reviewing quantity (10% birth weight), quality (e.g., visual, colostrometer, etc.) and timeliness (within 6 hours)
Penetrating captive bolt followed by a secondary method
IV barbiturate/ barbituric acid derivative/ intrathecal lidocaine (administered by a veterinarian)
No attempts to right itself or rise

prefreshAutoAnswerNotes.then: No pre-fresh heifers / dry cows on site.

stateAbbrev.title: State validator
stateAbbrev.description: Defines the list of state-like territories to accept for US 'state' validation

enum: Palleted forks with a supportive base
CIP - Q16 - Other - Heat and Cold
CIP - Q17 - Other - Housing Space/Visual Contact
CIP - Q19 - Other - Slips and Falls
CIP - Q26 - Action - Fitness to Transport (Action)
CIP - Q33 - Other - Translated Herd Health Plan
CIP - Q46 - Other - Segregated Sick/Injured Animals
CIP - Q52 - Other - Castration Pain Management
CIP - Q53 - Other - Branding Pain Management
CIP - Q54 - Animal Observations - Pre-Weaned Calf Body Condition
CIP - Q55 - Animal Observations - Pre-Weaned Calf Hygiene
CIP - Q57 - Animal Observations - Post-Weaned Heifer Hygiene
CIP - Q58 - Animal Observations - Dry and Pre-Fresh Heifer/Cow Hygiene
CIP - Q61 - Animal Observations - Lactating Cow Hygiene

calves.$comment: minimum quantity is the lesser of /herd/profile/numPreweaned and 100

heifers.$comment: minimum quantity is the lesser of /herd/profile/numHeifers and 100

milking.$comment: minimum quantity is the lesser of /herd/profile/numMilk and 100

issue.default: The facility does not have a written Veterinarian Client Patient Relationship (VCPR) that is signed by the farm owner and Veterinarian of Record in the last year (Question 9)

title.default: MCAP - Annually Reviewed Written Herd Health Plan

issue.default: The Veterinarian of Record did not review the Written Herd Health Plan in the last year (Question 10)

The facility does not have permanent, (written or electronic) treatment records for the treatment of the facility's common diseases that include: Date of treatment, animal treated identification, name of treatment used, disease/condition being treated, dosage administered, route of administration, duration of the treatment, specified withdrawal times for milk and meat to ensure food safety (Question 11)

Not all age classes of animals have access to sufficient quantities of feed for maintenance, health and growth (Question 14)

Actions and Protocol at the facility do not match for the transport of animals eligible for transport according to milk and meat withdrawal times (Question 26)
